plot: Disentangling the Computational Complexity of Network Untangling
summary: They study the network untangling problem introduced by Rozenshtein, Tatti, and Gionis [DMKD 2021] This problem has data mining applications in finding activity timelines that explain the interactions of entities in complex networks. The goal is to select at most $k$ time intervals for each. such that all time-edges are covered and (depending on the problem variant) either the maximum interval length or the total sum of interval lengths is minimized. They study a variant of Vertex Cover on temporal graphs -graphs whose edge set changes over discrete time steps.
